pros: It was a small college when I worked there as Dean, Student Services and now it has been a full fledge university with graduate programs as well. the educational is top notch and well respected in the medical field.
cons: it was a small school so one job included many aspects which made it an interest ting place to work but yet one was never giving the chance to completely develop a program.

review_title: It was good in the beginning but it turn horrible.
job_title: Worked In Adminstration in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: To be completely honest there really aren't any pros besides you get discounts around the area for some stores, apts, restaurants. Etc.
cons: The directors in administration and upper administration will try to tear their employees down. They lie constantly and will hold you down from improving and progressing at the college. They talk behind their own employees back but smile in there faces. The directors in administration is filled with clicks, yes even upper administration with high positions. If you're not in the click then good luck with pay increases. The students lie to get what they want. Basically, directors in administration will believe the students over their own employees any day. If you have credit hours they will admit you know matter if you have an 1.0 gpa. They don't honor their own policy and procedures for their own college!

review_title: Low pay, little support, heavy workload and no raises
